channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: From the subway to social media, NYC mayoral candidates make their closing arguments to voters
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In his final ad of the New York City mayoral race, Andrew Cuomo opens on a dour note: “Life in New York is tough right now.
item.dc:creator: ANTHONY IZAGUIRRE, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, KREX 5

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Trump signals he'll fund SNAP
item.description: President Trump indicated Friday he would fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) if given "the appropriate legal direction" after a federal judge ordered officials to spend an emergency fund for the program.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution after admitting to gruesome murder
item.description: South Carolina death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution for Nov. 14, becoming the third this year to select the method.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: What does SNAP stand for? Food assistance program set to be disrupted by government shutdown
item.description: (KRON) -- With the government shutdown that began on Oct. 1 about to enter its second month, dozens of government programs are already being impacted with further disruptions on the horizon.
item.dc:creator: Alex Baker, KRON4

item.title: Haven't gotten a Facebook settlement check? Here's what to do
item.description: Millions of people owed a piece of the massive $725 million Facebook privacy settlement have been receiving their payments.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Judges order Trump administration to use emergency reserves for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two federal judge have ruled that the Trump administration must continue to fund the SNAP food aid program using emergency reserve funds during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Michael Casey, Geoff Mulvihill And Kimberlee Kruesi, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Republicans battling behind scenes over funding SNAP during shutdown
item.description: Cracks are forming in the Senate GOP conference over whether benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) should be allowed to lapse this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, WGN 9

item.title: Biden-clemency con tied to downtown shooting months after early release – now faces federal charge
item.description: Federal officials condemn Khyre Holbert's early release under Joe Biden's commutation as he faces new charges following an October shooting in Omaha's Old Market.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, WGN 9

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO AP Congressional Correspondent, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of a congressional intern in Washington
item.description: A third teenager has been arrested and charged with the killing of a congressional intern in the nation's capital, a crime that President Donald Trump cited when he announced a law enforcement surge in Washington.
item.dc:creator: AUDREY McAVOY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Parents of Nashville school shooting victims fight to keep records out of public view
item.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — The parents of children killed in a shooting at a private Christian school in Nashville are fighting to keep police investigative records a secret, even after many documents were leaked to a conservative media outlet.
item.dc:creator: TRAVIS LOLLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: NASA takes one step closer to launching quiet supersonic jets
item.description: A supersonic jet plane designed to make very little noise took flight for the first time this week, cruising over the southern California desert just after sunrise in what could be the first step toward much faster commercial travel, according to NASA. NASA and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SAFIYAH RIDDLE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Funeral home recovers 300+ piles of human remains outside Las Vegas; investigation deepens
item.description: LAS VEGAS (KLAS) -- The federal investigation into who dumped more than 300 piles of human remains in the desert outside Las Vegas continues as a funeral home stepped up Wednesday to recover them.
item.dc:creator: David Charns, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Where the jewels stolen from the Louvre Museum might end up
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Seven people have been arrested in the investigation of a stunning heist at the Louvre Museum in Paris, but the lavish, stolen jewels that once adorned France's royals are still missing.
item.dc:creator: WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS and R.J. RICO, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Federal government shutdown threatens SNAP food aid as several states scramble to help
item.description: With federal SNAP food assistance set to run dry this weekend amid the protracted U.S. government shutdown, Louisiana, New Mexico and Vermont became the latest states Wednesday to announce help for low-income households that rely on the funds to eat.
item.dc:creator: MARGERY A. BECK and GEOFF MULVIHILL, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, KTLA 5
